INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Pursuant to Section 33-a of the New York City Charter, the New York City Council may vote on the following items no earlier than 30 days from the date of this notice. The New York City Council reserves the right to vote without the notice required pursuant to Section 33-a on any proposed local laws that do not relate to the public safety operations of the New York City Police Department, the Fire Department or the Department of Correction.
Items.AgendaNote: INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS - Pursuant to Section 33-a of the New York City Charter, the New York City Council may vote on the following items no earlier than 30 days from the date of this notice. Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to respect the true history and significance of national park sites, including the Stonewall National Monument
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.60 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Abreu) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Abreu) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 5 Council Members formally noted their intent to vote negative on this item: 

Council Members Aiola, Morano, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Carr).

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Respect the true history and significance of national park sites, including the Stonewall National Monument.

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Abreu) presiding as the President Pro Tempore.

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Abreu).


Note: there is a vacant seat on the Council pending the swearing-in of the certified winner of a Special Election to be held on April 28, 2026 in the 3rd Council District (Manhattan).
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Menin) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Menin), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Abreu) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Tuesday, February 24, 2026.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
